DOC.brief_summary: The primary objective study evaluate administration seasonal flu vaccine use jet injector device comparable traditional needle syringe delivery elicit immune response . A secondary objective compare safety two delivery method .
DOC.brief_title: Clinical Trial Assessing Immunologic Response Influenza Vaccine Delivered Using Jet Injection Device Needle Syringe
DOC.detailed_description: Needle-free jet injection device create fine stream pressurize liquid able deliver vaccine pharmaceutical product beneath skin . Design aspects quality , pressure , orifice size , angle injection relative skin injection stream coherence control depth product deliver . This technology provide safer delivery option patient healthcare staff remove need needle administration vaccine . In addition improve safety , additional benefit use jet injector include consistent reliable dose volume delivery , reduce vaccine waste , diminish need transport large quantity sharp , reduce risk needle stick , syringe reuse , cost associate sharps waste . Jet injector offer needle-free procedure individual adverse needle . This study compare efficacy disposable syringe jet injection device ( Stratis ) traditional needle syringe ( NS ) administration delivery trivalent inactivate influenza vaccine . Efficacy evaluate compare measure hemagglutination inhibition ( HI ) ; specifically GMTs , seroconversion seroprotection . Safety two administration device evaluate comparison incidence solicit local systemic adverse event .
DOC.criteria: Female male subject age 18 59 year Healthy volunteer Able provide inform consent understand study procedure per ICH/GCP guideline Plans remain study area length trial ; able adhere study visit followup schedule Able complete study diary Unwilling unable undergo two blood draw per protocol Have receive influenza vaccination last twelve month Have receive vaccination last month Currently take antibiotic , steroid , phenytoin , chemotherapy , immunosuppressive drug Received recent blood , blood product , parenteral preparation immunoglobulin ( within 3 month ) Suffers allergic reaction egg , gelatin , neomycin history anaphylactic shock , asthma , urticaria , allergic reaction vaccination . Had serious adverse event associate prior vaccination Has immunodeficiency autoimmune disease ( include HIV ) History chronic alcohol abuse Participating another study concurrently Pregnant breastfeeding study
